intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium triasii, commonly known as the Triassic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Hieracium triasii is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, though it can be sensitive to environmental changes.
